$$

The healing length is derived from the Gross-Pitaevskii equation in the **uniform case** where $ \psi(x) = \sqrt{n} $, a constant.

Substituting this into the GP equation gives:

$$
g n = \mu
$$

$$
\frac{d^2 \delta n}{dx^2} = \frac{4 m g n}{\hbar^2} \delta n

$$

$$
\boxed{L_q = \frac{\hbar}{\sqrt{2 m g n}}}
$$

$$
\left( \frac{d\tilde{f}}{dy} \right)^2 = \tilde{f}^2 \left( 1 - \frac{1}{2} \tilde{f}^2 \right)

$$
\boxed{L_q = \frac{\hbar}{\sqrt{2 m g n}}}
